author: greg_duncan
title: this is pretty good
review: I love when lego released sets like this. this one in particular was pretty good, because it included both krana and kanohi, both excellent kollectables by themselves and together made a great variety pack, kinda like lunchables. the kanohi were metallically coloured, which was real cool.

author: Imperial13
title: Not "a collectible" (spelled right)
review:
First off, this is not the highlight of my lego collection. It comes with 3 Krana and two masks of power (I'm sooooooooo excited). Just dont buy it, you'll probably regret it.
P.S. This is not a set, just a stupid expansion pack.

author: Yoda____
title: masks...
review:
...and thats about it. They're still good ones because I remember getting a gold one and a silver one so ,because they were different colours of masks i had from bionicles i had, i put them on bionicles that i had brought. I remember this set came a leaflet that showed all the different masks and for brickset, i think tere were 7 different colours for each mask (ore 7 masks for each colour (or 6)).

It turned out I reviewed the wrong set before but I'm just writing the review for the right set now.

author: Dragon_Master_48
title: The Bohrok Swarms Move Out...
review:
To go along with the Bohrok Swarms (which include the Standard Bohrok, the Bohrok-Va, and Bohrok-Kal), LEGO released 8559 for BIONICLE fans to expand their collections, or merely provide more variety among the Krana they already have.

Pros

  • One Golden Kanohi, and one Silver Kanohi.
  • In the US, it was released in a box instead of a polybag.
  • Krana! The main focus of the set.

Cons

  • Could have included five Krana instead of three...

This is a wonderful addition to the collection of any BIONICLE fan, although the selection might be a bit disappointing for those wanting a little bit more. If only LEGO still produced these...

author: BionicleMaster2001_2010
title: Well Done
review:
When this came out in 2002, I bought a lot of these, so I got a lot of masks and krana. They were awesome back then, and there still awesome now, and I plan to get another one someday, to relive the memories. I highly recommend this for both young LEGO fans and Bionicle Fans.


Pros:

1 Gold and 1 Silver Mask

3 Random Color Krana

Cons:
No heads like in the 2001 Kanohi Packs
